It might seem like a silly task when you think of the busy day ahead, but making your bed can actually have a big impact on the rest of your day and the way you sleep at night. Let me tell you why.
Your bed plays such a big part in your life that you owe it to yourself to make your bedroom your sanctuary – a place that’s relaxing, calm and comfortable (Click to find out how to make your own sleep sanctuary). The problem is that even after doing this, your bedroom can easily become neglected, untidy and cluttered, turning back into just being the place you crash at night and rush out of in the morning. Don’t worry – you can keep your bedroom the restful retreat that heals your body and your mind by just making your bed.
It helps you conquer the day
When you make your bed, the whole room is instantly refreshed. A messy bedroom isn’t inspiring – it’s actually tiring. When you are busy making your bed, you are also refreshing your mind because this small task gives you a sense of pride, empowering you to go out into your day and conquer other tasks – small AND big!
It inspires you and gives you energy
Making your bed every day is a good habit that has a domino effect. When you’re organised in one small part of your life, you’ll find you are inspired to organise other parts of your life that you haven’t had the time or energy to manage before.

It calms you
Lastly, a beautifully made bed shows off the beautiful bedding set that tidies your room together, creating a calming effect that sets you up for a good night’s sleep. There’s nothing better than climbing into a bed that you’ve taken the time to customise especially for you, made up just the way you like it.

The HomeChoice Sleep Expert
Dudu works for HomeChoice helping select the products to enhance our customers’ sleep. As a mother of active twin boys, she is passionate about getting a good night’s rest and firmly believes in the restorative benefits of 8 hours of comfortable, uninterrupted sleep.
